Cleveland Cavaliers forward LeBron James (23) and forward Richard Jefferson (24) and center Tristan Thompson (13) and guard Kyrie Irving (2) and guard Iman Shumpert (4) wait for play to begin against the Dallas Mavericks during the second half at the American Airlines Center. The Mavericks defeat the Cavaliers 104-97. (Photo: AP) 
Last Friday, Kyrie Irving said that he believes the Earth is flat on his teammates' Richard Jefferson and Channing Frye's Road Trippin' podcast. Since then, many jokes have been made and Irving sort of backed down, while NBA commissioner Adam Silver said the Cavs guard was simply "trying to be provocative." 
Almost a week later, on Wednesday, a photo surfaced of Jefferson wearing a hilarious "Flat World Champions" shirt. It's said to be a screengrab from an Instagram Live video on the Road Trippin' IG account. For those wondering how the Cavs are taking Kyrie's comments about Earth being flat, here's RJ's shirt during Road Trippin's live IG video: pic.twitter.com/JqngnY86Z8 â€” Josh Poloha (@JorshP) February 22, 2017 
The shirt is made by Fresh Brewed Tees. â€” Fresh Brewed Tees (@FreshBrewedTees) February 19, 2017 
Jefferson has commented on Irving's strange belief. On The Jump , the Cavaliers vet said that he thinks "it was more to open people's thoughts and people's minds," echoing what the league commissioner said to reporters at All-Star Weekend. Richard Jefferson and Byron Scott react to Kyrie's "Earth is flat" comments on The Jump on ESPN pic.twitter.com/euCxd9By5d â€” Keith Britton (@KeithBritton86) February 20, 2017 
As for the podcast, you can listen to that on iTunes and other places. The newest episode features Kyle Korver and dropped on Wednesday.
